meanings.definition: The long threadlike part of a nerve cell along which impulses are conducted.
meanings.sent1: The neuraxons in the nerve cell help carry messages to the brain.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the neuraxons to understand how the nervous system works.
meanings.sent3: The neuraxons in the neuron had a race to see which could transmit the message faster.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts traveled along the neuraxons like cars on a highway.
meanings.sent5: The neuraxons looked like tiny wires connecting different parts of the body.

meanings.definition: The main conducting unit of the nervous system.
meanings.sent1: The neuraxons play a crucial role in transmitting signals throughout the body.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are fascinated by the complexity of the neuraxons in the nervous system.
meanings.sent3: The neuraxons threw a party to celebrate their important job in the body.
meanings.sent4: The neuraxons acted like messengers delivering urgent information.
meanings.sent5: The neuraxons are like the highways of the nervous system, ensuring smooth communication.

meanings.definition: The part of a neuron that carries nerve impulses.
meanings.sent1: Damage to the neuraxons can disrupt the flow of nerve signals.
meanings.sent2: Neuraxons are essential for the transmission of information within the brain.
meanings.sent3: The neuraxons decided to take a vacation, causing a temporary communication breakdown.
meanings.sent4: The neuraxons function like electrical wires, transmitting signals at lightning speed.
meanings.sent5: The neuraxons are like messengers delivering urgent messages to the brain.
